wiki.content:
The Message is the last song from Dr. Dre's album 2001, closing out the album. It is dedicated to his deceased brother, Tyree. The lyrics were ghostwritten by rapper Royce da 5'9". Controversy followed when this information came out, as the subject matter of the song is very personal and it wasn't even written by Dre.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: The Message is the last song from Dr. Dre's album 2001, closing out the album. It is dedicated to his deceased brother, Tyree. The lyrics were ghostwritten by rapper Royce da 5'9". Controversy followed when this information came out, as the subject matter of the song is very personal and it wasn't even written by Dre.

track.name: The Message
comments: I agree with @projectpat42066 ... Mary J Blige was the right one to do the vocals for this track.
An excellent and very personal track by Dre. How good is that !?
The obligatory one great song on the album that actually shows some personality beyond bragging about how awesome Dr. Dre is.
Lord Finesse did an amazing job making this beat. He even did Suicidal Thoughts which was also a outro.
The"" GOOD DOCTOR"" at his Finest!
re: projectpat's comment.. pretty true, especially for this song :) .. and then there is Ms Badu.
in its way, this is the most badass track on the album
DONT FORGET MARY J ON THE VOCALS. HE DEFINTLY PICED THE RIGHT ONE TO DO VOCALS. IF YOU WANT TO PAINT A VERY VIVID EMOTIONAL PICTURE NOBODY CAN DO IT BETTER THEN HER.
Royce da 5'9 wrote this song for Dre
LORD FINESSE PRODUCED THIS. NOT DRE.
Amazing beat, really different Dre on this track. It's awesome.
firme, happy this fool back axd rappx
this song is just beautiful. really refreshing compared to all Dre's overused (but still somewhat enjoyable) gangsta stuff on the album.
This is one of the best RIP tracks ever,without a doubt...
